definitions.title: pron. indef.
definitions.body: anything (acc. to Thes from [[מָה וּמָה]], like quidquid, against which is the Milïel tone; acc. to Ol:254, 255, 386 Kö:ii. 146 an old accus. from [[מאוּם]] in sense of speck, particle, cf. Fr. point: in As. manman (prop. who ? who ?), assim. mamman, or manma (man, who ? + generalizing ma), mamma, is any one, minma (min, what ? + ma) , mimma, is anything, Dl:§ 60, HWB 418 f; W:SG 125 f.);—anything, usually in negative sentences, as Ge 22:12 [[ואל־תעשׂ לו מאומה]] (euphem. for something bad), Ge 30:31 [[מאומה לאׁ־תִתֶּן־לִי]], Ge 39:6, Ge 39:9, Ge 40:15 (euphem.), 1Sa 12:4, 1Sa 12:5, 1Sa 20:26, 1Sa 20:39, 1Sa 25:7, 1Sa 25:15, 1Sa 25:21, 1Sa 29:3 etc., Ju Jdg 14:6 [[ומאומה אין בידו]], Ec 5:14 [[לא ישׂא בעמלו]] ´[[ומ]] 1Ki 18:43 ´[[אין מ]] lit. nought of anything ! Je 39:12 [[ואל תעשׂ לו מאומה רָּע]]; strengthened by [[כּׂל]] † Ge 39:23, 2Sa 3:35; after [[אִם]] = surely not, 2Sa 3:35; in interrog. sentence Nu 22:38; in affirm. sentence De 24:10 [[כִּי־תַשֶּׁה]] ´[[בְרֵעֲ ְמַשֵּׁאת מ]] a pledge of (= consisting in) anything, 2Sa 13:2 (euphem.), 2Ki 5:20. Used adverbially, 1Sa 21:3 [[את הדבר]] ´[[אישׁ אל ידע מ]] let no one know of the matter in anything at all.
